public_information: Available action schemata with their preconditions and effects: paltry requires hand obj0, cats obj1, texture obj2, vase obj0 obj1 false to be true, next obj1 obj2 true; paltry makes next obj0 obj2 true and makes vase obj0 obj1 false after execution.
sip requires hand obj0, cats obj1, texture obj2, next obj0 obj2 true, next obj1 obj2 true; sip makes vase obj0 obj1 true and makes next obj0 obj2 false after execution.
clip requires hand obj0, sneeze obj1, texture obj2, next obj1 obj2 true, next obj0 obj2 true; clip makes vase obj0 obj1 true and makes next obj0 obj2 false after execution.

wretched requires sneeze obj0, texture obj1, texture obj2, stupendous obj3, next obj0 obj1 true, collect obj1 obj3 true, collect obj2 obj3 true; wretched makes next obj0 obj2 true and makes next obj0 obj1 false after execution.
memory requires cats obj0, spring obj1, spring obj2, next obj0 obj1 true; memory makes next obj0 obj2 true and makes next obj0 obj1 false after execution.
tightfisted requires hand obj0, sneeze obj1, texture obj2, next obj1 obj2 true, vase obj0 obj1 true; tightfisted makes next obj0 obj2 true and makes vase obj0 obj1 false after execution.
Predicates observed in the domain include hand, cats, texture, vase, next, sneeze, spring, collect, stupendous. Objects are named object_0 through object_14 across the statements.

Orchestrator must produce a single consistent PDDL domain and problem file that encodes these action schemata, uses the observed objects and initial predicates from the agent statements, and encodes the goals provided by the agents. The PDDL must be compatible with the FastDownwards solver and use STRIPS-compatible constructs.

analyze.system_prompt: You are an analyst agent. Given the provided public information and your private statement you should produce a structured analysis. Extract the universe of objects present, enumerate all ground predicates that are true in the provided initial state, list each planned step with its parameters, for each planned step identify required preconditions and the effects that must hold according to the public action schemata, and check whether the sequence achieves the stated goal. Report any missing preconditions or conflicts. Do not generate PDDL.

You are an analyst agent. Given the provided public information and your private statement you should produce a structured analysis. Extract the universe of objects present, enumerate all ground predicates that are true in the provided initial state, identify missing plan steps or propose candidate actions that could help achieve the stated goal, and list any ambiguities or information gaps. Do not generate PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in PDDL modeling and in preparing problems for the FastDownwards planner. You will receive structured analyses from other agents. Your job is to integrate those analyses, resolve naming or predicate mismatches, and produce a final PDDL domain and PDDL problem that encode the actions, all relevant objects, the combined initial state items to be considered, and the goals. The PDDL must be compatible with FastDownwards: use STRIPS-style action definitions, explicit predicates, and avoid ADL features that FastDownwards may not support by default. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep actions distinct and preserve the original action names paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted. Where multiple agent goals exist, include them all in the problem goal (conjunction). If there is any unavoidable ambiguity, document your resolution choice in a short comment section before the PDDL files.

orchestrator.prompt: You will receive two analyses from other agents. Integrate their findings, include all objects and initial predicates that are relevant, and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for FastDownwards. Keep actions separate and ensure preconditions and effects match the public action schemata. Here is the public information to use: {environment->public_information} Here is the analysis from the first agent: {analysis_agent1} Here is the analysis from the second agent: {analysis_agent2} The final PDDL must be returned with the domain enclosed in <domain></domain> and the problem enclosed in <problem></problem>. Prepend a brief comment describing any disambiguation decisions.
